result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: APPLY BAIL OF $50.00. Balance to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 7/01/2015, along with payment plan fee of $15.00. Alternate 10 days jail.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie Bryant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   ADA Bryan Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 2:
- Fine totaling $505.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 07/01/2015; alternate 10 days jail - APPLY BAIL
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date before June 15, 2015 for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has an offer if defendant obtains his license. Court will give another date. Defense to let the court know on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court at 11:15 a.m..  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advises he does have counsel, but counsel couldn't appear today. Court will give another date in 3 weeks.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant to seek counsel. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation or  Defendant to seek counsel. Court will put the matter out for 3 weeks.   State has offer to amend charge if defendant obtains a license.  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Jessie Bryant in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
